info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 13 at 1:44PM MST by NWS Phoenix AZ
info.description:
At 144 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Arizona State Fairgrounds, or near Laveen, moving north at 30 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible.
Locations impacted include... Phoenix, Glendale, Scottsdale, Paradise Valley, Tolleson, Laveen, Piestewa Peak Park, Deer Valley Airport, North Mountain Park, South Phoenix, Arizona State Fairgrounds, Downtown Peoria, Downtown Phoenix, Arrowhead Mall, Downtown Glendale, Metro Center, Scottsdale Airport, Camelback Mountain, Sky Harbor Airport, and Desert Ridge Marketplace.
This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 135 and 152. AZ Interstate 17 between mile markers 195 and 223. AZ Route 51 between mile markers 1 and 15.
info.instruction:
If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

parameter.value: A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT MARICOPA COUNTY THROUGH 230 PM MST

area.areaDesc: Buckeye/Avondale; Cave Creek/New River; Deer Valley; Central Phoenix; North Phoenix/Glendale; Scottsdale/Paradise Valley; South Mountain/Ahwatukee
